FuncDef:
The ipv6-address port priority command configures an IP address, a port number, a transport protocol, an encryption mode, and a priority for a destination collector.
The undo ipv6-address port priority command deletes the IP address, port number, transmission protocol, encryption mode, and priority of a destination collector. The ipv6-address port priority command configures an IP address, a port number, a transport protocol, an encryption mode, and a priority for a destination collector. The undo ipv6-address port priority command deletes the IP address, port number, transmission protocol, encryption mode, and priority of a destination collector. By default, no IP address, port number, transport protocol, encryption mode, or priority is configured for the destination collector.
CLIs: ipv6-address <ip-address-ipv6> port <port-value> [ vpn-instance <vpn-name> ] [ protocolgrpc [ no-tls ] [ compressiongzip ] ] priority { low | medium | high }
undo ipv6-address <ip-address-ipv6> port <port-value> [ vpn-instance <vpn-name> ] [ protocolgrpc [ no-tls ] [ compressiongzip ] ] priority { low | medium | high }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv6 address for the destination collector.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies a port number for the destination collector.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 65535.

Specifies a VPN instance name for the destination collector.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters. The value must be the name of an existing VPN instance.

Sets the data reporting protocol to gRPC.
-

Indicates whether TLS encryption is used.
If this parameter is set, TLS encryption is not used.If this parameter is not set, TLS encryption can be used.
-

Specifies the data reporting compression type.
-

Indicates that the compression type of reported data is gzip.
-

Sets the priority of the destination collector to low.
-

Sets the priority of the destination collector to medium.
-

Sets the priority of the destination collector to high.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-telemetry-destination-group-test] ipv6-address 2001:DB8:2::1 port 10001 protocol grpc no-tls priority high
ExtraInfo: After a destination group is created, you can run this command to configure the IP address, port number, transport protocol, encryption mode, and priority of the destination collector.
